abstract: The Quad doesn't offer loud, controversial country singers, or even fighting robots. But every Saturday, it does throw a heck of a college football watch party. Times reporters will offer analysis and commentary of the key moments and news from Saturday's games. Join the conversation.
snippet: The Quad doesn't offer loud, controversial country singers, or even fighting robots. But every Saturday, it does throw a heck of a college football watch party. Times reporters will offer analysis and commentary of the key moments and news from...
lead_paragraph: The Quad doesn't offer loud, controversial country singers, or even fighting robots. But every Saturday, it does throw a heck of a college football watch party. Zach Hillesland will be spanning the country this week, offering analysis, commentary and perhaps a chuckle or two. He'll get help from Pete Thamel and staff reports from the Oklahoma-Texas and Pitt-Rutgers games. And don't forget, The Quad needs your help, whether it be from the couch, the local pub or the 50-yard line.

headline.main: Are You Ready for Some College Football?
